jparsec.graph.chartRendering.frame

Class SkyRendering

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.graph.chartRendering.frame.SkyRendering
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class SkyRendering
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Support class to use Swing/AWT graph components for sky and planetary rendering. See also SkyChart class.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    SkyChart, Serialized Form

        obs - Observer object.
        eph - Ephemeris object.
        render - SkyRender object.

      • update

        public void update(SkyRenderElement sky,
          TimeElement time,
          ObserverElement obs,
          EphemerisElement eph)
            throws JPARSECException
        Updates the sky, time and/or observer objects for the rendering.
        Parameters:
        sky - A new sky object, or null to keep the current one.
        time - A new time object, or null to keep the current one.
        obs - A new observer, or null to keep the current one.
        eph - A new ephemeris object, or null to keep the current one.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException

      • createTransparentBufferedImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage createTransparentBufferedImage()
                                                            throws JPARSECException
        Returns a BufferedImage instance with the current rendering, adequate to write an image to disk. The returned image has a transparent (alpha) channel. To use transparency in sky rendering you should also call AWTGraphics.setBufferedImageType(int).
        Returns:
        The image.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the method fails.

      • getLastRenderedImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getLastRenderedImage()
                                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns a BufferedImage instance with the last rendering done.
        Returns:
        The last rendering.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the method fails.

      • setJupiterGRSLongitude

        public void setJupiterGRSLongitude(double GRS_lon,
                          int system)
        Sets the longitude of Jupiter's Great Red Spot.

        Please note that the rendering will use the default value of the longitude of central meridian for rendering. This value is refered to System III for giant planets (rotation of the magnetic field), so the apparent rotation will not match that of the observed equatorial nor tropical belts in these planets. This function is intended to adjust specifically the apparent sight of Jupiter's disk.

        Parameters:
        GRS_lon - Observed longitude in radians.
        system - System of coordinates of GRS_lon, 1, 2, or 3. Will be ussually 2, since the Great Red Spot is in the tropical belt (1 refers to equatorial belt, and 3 to the rotation of the magnetic field).

      • setBackgroundColor
